Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Oxiris Membrane in Cardiac Surgery

Participants.evidence: Adult patients scheduled for cardiac surgery with expected CPB duration over 90 minutes were included.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomized 1:1 to either the Oxiris group, receiving hemadsorption via the Oxiris membrane on a Prismaflex device at 450 ml/min during CPB, or the standard group without the device.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated whether the Oxiris membrane, an AN-69 hemadsorption device, could reduce inflammation, preserve endothelial function, and improve postoperative outcomes in high-risk patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the microvascular flow index on day 1 post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was performed using Clinsight software with random block sizes of 10.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From October 2019 to November 2022, 70 patients were randomized (35 per group).

Number_Analysed.evidence: Two patients in the Oxiris group were excluded post-randomization.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The microvascular flow index did not significantly differ between groups on day 1: difference (95% CI) Oxiris minus standard at -0.17 (-0.44 to 0.10); P = 0.2.

Harms.evidence: Composite adverse outcomes were similar (Oxiris: 14/33 [42%] vs. standard: 12/35 [35%]; P = 0.7).
